channel.title: Security-Misc on another debian based distro
channel.description:
I have tried to install security-misc package on another debian based distro (Antix) which is a non-systemd distribution, but after installation when i try to execute commands as sudo or root i get these messages.
When i execute command as a root "/usr/libexec/security-misc/pam-info: line 78: faillock: command not found"
When i execute commands as sudo "PAM account management error: Module is unknown"
I can't start anything that requires sudo or su privileges. Sudo and console groups are created and user is added inside them, what can i do?

item.title: Security-Misc on another debian based distro
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Needs to be bullseye based. Otherwise faillock isn’t available.

Unsupported.

Whonix – 13 Sep 21

Undocumented, Untested or Unsupported Features

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become a Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

Read full topic
item.source: Security-Misc on another debian based distro

item.title: Security-Misc on another debian based distro
item.dc:creator: anonimac
item.description:
I have tried to install security-misc package on another debian based distro (Antix) which is a non-systemd distribution, but after installation when i try to execute commands as sudo or root i get these messages.

When i execute command as a root
“/usr/libexec/security-misc/pam-info: line 78: faillock: command not found”

When i execute commands as sudo
“PAM account management error: Module is unknown”

I can’t start anything that requires sudo or su privileges. Sudo and console groups are created and user is added inside them, what can i do?
